intro: Margaritopsis carrascoana, commonly known as the Carrascoana margaritopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
